bioprojects.title: Escherichia coli HK02

description.title: Escherichia coli HK02 - O25:H4-ST131 clone (wastewater)
description.comment: Strain Escherichia coli HK02 is a member of globally distributed clonal complex of ExPEC strain ST131. Laterally acquired antibiotic resistance gene blaCTX-M-15, located on the chromosome, is responsible for the ESBL phenotype, while point mutations in parC and gyrA regions confer resistance to ciprofloxacin. The strain showed resistance to amoxicillin/clavulanic acid, sulfamethoxazole, alone and in the combination with trimethoprim, which can be attributed to number of unspecific efflux pumps encoded by housekeeping genes. Production of ESBL enzymes and resistance to fluoroquinolones together with fimH30 allelic variation classify sequenced isolate as a member of H30Rx clade. Since there are no specific virulence factors strictly connected with ExPEC pathotype, the strain is classified based on the genetic similarity with the known, infection-causing, strains. The isolate is identified as a human pathogen, associated with blood stream and urinary tract infections (UTIs), acquired in both, community and in hospital settings.

attributes.name: genotype
attributes.value: ESBL producer resistant to CAZ, CTX, AMC, CIP, SXT, RL (EUCAST guidelines)

description.title: Silver resistant mutant from Escherichia coli ATCC 8739
description.comment: Strain obtained in laboratory conditions by stepwise adaptation of Escherichia coli ATCC 8739 to increasing silver nitrate concentrations. This strain differs from the parental in having a mutation in a region putative for SilR gene from the sil operon. This mutation results in the constitutive expression of silCFBA, leading to the resistant phenotype.

assembly_info.comments:
The annotation of this whole genome reference is derived from the Escherichia coli K-12 strain MC4100 substrain BW2952 reference (accession NC_012759) by whole genome Illumina paired-end sequencing, read mapping, variant calling, and reference adaptation by application of variants and manual curation of further annotation changes.
The annotation was added by the NCBI Prokaryotic Genome Annotation Pipeline (PGAP). Information about PGAP can be found here: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/genome/annotation_prok/

average_nucleotide_identity.submitted_organism: Escherichia coli str. K-12 substr. MC4100
